lines: Two guys just claimed they made a two hundred million dollar movie in one day.
But wait - they didn't spend a single penny on real actors or fancy cameras at all.
The Dor Brothers posted their so-called movie masterpiece just last week on social media bragging about it.
They used nothing but AI computer tools to make every single scene and every character you see.
But here's what doesn't make sense - how does a computer movie cost more than real Marvel movies?
It doesn't cost anything - they're just saying their cheap AI test is worth Hollywood blockbuster money.
Real movie makers are going crazy mad over this silly fake comparison right now across the internet.
Follow me for more wild AI movie drama stories that everyone's talking about.

lines: Two guys made a movie in one day and called it worth two hundred million dollars.
But this wasn't some big budget film or new tech breakthrough at all.
The Dor Brothers decided last week to make a full movie in just twenty four hours using AI.
They used AI tools to create every scene, every character, and all the talking parts too.
Then they said their quick AI experiment was just as good as real Hollywood blockbuster movies.
These guys really thought their one day AI mashup matched actual two hundred million dollar films.

lines: Jimmy Kimmel got totally cancelled after one monologue that most people never saw.
But this was not some crazy political rant or big celebrity fight gone wrong.
Last month the late night host went on TV and did what looked like his normal comedy show.
He made jokes about current events and roasted a bunch of celebrities just like he always does every night.
So what could he have said that was so bad it ended his whole career forever?
The entire monologue was completely fake and never actually happened at all in real life.
People shared fake video clips and angry posts for weeks over something that was not even real.
Follow to see more fake drama that completely fooled everyone on the internet like this.

The crowd was laughing, everything looked fine, just another regular Tuesday night for him.

Turns out her fans have way more power than Disney bosses ever will.
In just hours his whole show got pulled and he had to say sorry three times.

lines: Jimmy Kimmel got cancelled for telling the truth on live TV.
But that's not what actually happened to the late night host at all.
Last week he delivered a controversial monologue that had the entire internet buzzing with outraged reactions.
The jokes were sharp and the timing was perfect, but something about the whole dramatic situation felt completely off.
Then the full uncut video of his show leaked online and people started asking serious questions about what really happened.
Turns out he never actually got cancelled for anything he said that night on television.
The whole dramatic story was completely fake news designed to get easy clicks and views from angry viewers.
Want to see the real uncut footage that exposes these fake headlines?
